subject: Writing
title: Flannery O'Connor's Dark Grace
description: A micro-lesson that makes Flannery O'Connor's Dark Grace usable.

hook.text: O'Connor raised peacocks, battled lupus, and wrote the most violently spiritual stories in American fiction.

buildup.text: Her stories are set in the American South and explore faith, hypocrisy, and sudden moments of grace.

discovery.text: She used grotesque characters and shocking violence to jolt readers into moral awareness.

twist.text: O'Connor was a devout Catholic whose faith drove her darkest fiction ‚Äî grace arrives through horror.

climax.text: A Good Man Is Hard to Find remains one of the most taught short stories in the English language.

punchline.text: She found God in the strangest, scariest places.

quiz.question: What recurring theme defines Flannery O'Connor's stories?
options: Grace arriving through violence and shock
